events.title: First Aliyah Begins
events.description: The first major wave of Jewish immigration to Palestine begins, marking the start of Zionist settlement and changing the demographic balance of the region.

events.title: First Zionist Congress
events.description: Theodor Herzl convenes the First Zionist Congress, establishing the World Zionist Organization and formalizing plans for a Jewish state in Palestine.

events.title: McMahon-Hussein Correspondence
events.description: Britain pledges Arab independence in exchange for revolting against the Ottomans, but later betrays these promises with the Balfour Declaration, highlighting British duplicity that affects both Arabs and Jews.

events.title: Balfour Declaration
events.description: Britain issues the Balfour Declaration, promising support for a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine without consulting the indigenous Palestinian population.

events.title: British Mandate Begins
events.description: The League of Nations grants Britain the mandate to govern Palestine, beginning a period of British colonial rule that facilitates increased Jewish immigration.

events.title: Nebi Musa Riots
events.description: Palestinian Arab riots break out in Jerusalem during the Nebi Musa festival, expressing opposition to Zionist immigration and British policies.

events.title: 1929 Palestinian Uprising
events.description: Widespread Palestinian protests and violence erupt across Palestine in response to growing Jewish immigration and land purchases, resulting in hundreds of casualties.

events.title: Great Arab Revolt Begins
events.description: A three-year Palestinian uprising against British rule and Zionist immigration begins, led by the Arab Higher Committee and involving strikes, protests, and armed resistance.

events.title: Peel Commission Recommends Partition
events.description: The British Peel Commission recommends partitioning Palestine into separate Jewish and Arab states, allocating most of the land to the Jewish minority, a proposal rejected by Palestinian leaders as unfair.

events.title: White Paper Limits Immigration
events.description: Britain issues the White Paper, limiting Jewish immigration to Palestine, but Palestinians view it as too little too late after years of demographic change.

events.title: King David Hotel Bombing
events.description: Zionist paramilitary group Irgun bombs the British headquarters in Jerusalem, killing 91 people, highlighting escalating Zionist militancy and British favoritism toward Jewish settlers.

events.title: UN Partition Plan
events.description: The United Nations votes to partition Palestine, allocating 56% of the land to a Jewish state despite Jews comprising about one-third of the population, a decision Palestinians reject.

events.title: Nakba Begins
events.description: The Palestinian Nakba (catastrophe) begins as hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are displaced from their homes during the establishment of Israel, creating a refugee crisis that continues today.

events.title: Deir Yassin Massacre
events.description: Zionist paramilitary forces kill over 100 Palestinian civilians in the village of Deir Yassin, becoming a symbol of Palestinian suffering during the Nakba.

events.title: Armistice Agreements
events.description: Armistice agreements are signed, leaving Palestinians divided between Israel, the West Bank (under Jordan), and Gaza (under Egypt), with no independent Palestinian state.

events.title: Fedayeen Raids Begin
events.description: Palestinian refugees begin conducting raids from Gaza and the West Bank into Israel, representing early armed resistance against border restrictions and lost lands, prompting Israeli reprisals.

events.title: Jordan Annexes West Bank
events.description: Jordan formally annexes the West Bank, granting Palestinians there Jordanian citizenship but maintaining their identity as Palestinians.

events.title: PLO Founded
events.description: The Palestine Liberation Organization is founded at the Arab League summit, becoming the main representative body of the Palestinian people.

events.title: Naksa - Six-Day War
events.description: Israel occupies the West Bank, Gaza Strip, and East Jerusalem during the Six-Day War, beginning a military occupation that continues for decades.

events.title: Battle of Karameh
events.description: Palestinian fedayeen fighters, supported by Jordanian forces, resist an Israeli attack on the Karameh refugee camp, becoming a symbol of Palestinian resistance.

events.title: Black September
events.description: Jordan expels the PLO after violent clashes, forcing Palestinian fighters to relocate to Lebanon and marking a turning point in Palestinian-Jordanian relations.

events.title: Munich Olympics Attack
events.description: Palestinian Black September group attacks Israeli athletes at the Munich Olympics, killing 11, an act of desperation to draw global attention to the refugee plight and ongoing occupation.

events.title: PLO Recognized as Palestinian Representative
events.description: The Arab League and United Nations recognize the PLO as the sole legitimate representative of the Palestinian people.

events.title: Sabra and Shatila Massacre
events.description: Lebanese Christian militias, with Israeli complicity, massacre hundreds of Palestinian refugees in the Sabra and Shatila camps in Beirut.

events.title: First Intifada Begins
events.description: The First Intifada begins in the West Bank and Gaza Strip, a popular uprising marked by civil disobedience, strikes, and stone-throwing against Israeli occupation.

events.title: Hamas Founded
events.description: Hamas is founded as a grassroots resistance movement during the First Intifada, providing social services amid occupation and representing a shift from secular PLO to Islamist factions.

events.title: Palestinian Declaration of Independence
events.description: The PLO declares Palestinian independence and accepts UN Resolution 242, implicitly recognizing Israel's right to exist in exchange for a Palestinian state.

events.title: Madrid Conference
events.description: Palestinians participate in the Madrid Peace Conference, marking the first time Palestinians engage in direct negotiations with Israel.

events.title: Oslo Accords Signed
events.description: Israel and the PLO sign the Oslo Accords, establishing the Palestinian Authority and creating hope for a two-state solution, though many Palestinians remain skeptical.

events.title: Palestinian Authority Established
events.description: Yasser Arafat returns to Gaza and establishes the Palestinian Authority, beginning limited self-rule in parts of the West Bank and Gaza Strip.

events.title: Camp David Summit Failure
events.description: The Camp David peace summit collapses as Palestinian leaders reject Israeli proposals as insufficient on refugees, Jerusalem, and borders, leading to blame for the diplomatic impasse.

events.title: Second Intifada Begins
events.description: The Al-Aqsa Intifada begins after Ariel Sharon's visit to the Temple Mount, escalating into years of violence and Israeli military operations in Palestinian territories.

events.title: Battle of Jenin
events.description: Israeli forces launch a major military operation in the Jenin refugee camp, resulting in significant Palestinian casualties and destruction.

events.title: Death of Yasser Arafat
events.description: Yasser Arafat, the longtime leader of the PLO and Palestinian Authority, dies in Paris, marking the end of an era in Palestinian politics.

events.title: Mahmoud Abbas Elected
events.description: Mahmoud Abbas is elected President of the Palestinian Authority, succeeding Yasser Arafat and committing to a diplomatic approach to achieving Palestinian statehood.

events.title: Hamas Wins Legislative Elections
events.description: Hamas wins a majority in Palestinian Legislative Council elections, leading to international isolation and internal Palestinian political division.

events.title: Gaza Blockade Begins
events.description: Israel imposes a strict blockade on the Gaza Strip after Hamas takes control, severely restricting movement and access to basic necessities for Gaza's population.

events.title: Operation Cast Lead
events.description: Israel launches a major military operation in Gaza, resulting in over 1,400 Palestinian deaths and widespread destruction, while Hamas fires rockets into Israel.

events.title: Gaza Flotilla Raid
events.description: Israeli forces raid humanitarian aid ships attempting to break the Gaza blockade, killing 9 activists and highlighting the blockade's devastating impact on Palestinian civilians.

events.title: Palestinian Statehood Bid
events.description: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas submits a request for full UN membership, seeking recognition of Palestine as an independent state.

events.title: UN Grants Palestine Non-Member Observer Status
events.description: The UN General Assembly upgrades Palestine to non-member observer state status, a symbolic but significant step toward international recognition.

events.title: Operation Protective Edge
events.description: A 50-day conflict between Israel and Hamas in Gaza results in over 2,200 Palestinian deaths and massive destruction of infrastructure in the Gaza Strip.

events.title: Hamas-Fatah Reconciliation Agreement
events.description: Hamas and Fatah sign a reconciliation agreement in Cairo, attempting to end a decade of political division, though implementation remains limited.

events.title: US Embassy Move to Jerusalem
events.description: The United States moves its embassy to Jerusalem, a provocation that undermines the two-state solution and sparks the Great March of Return protests in Gaza.

events.title: Great March of Return Begins
events.description: Palestinians in Gaza begin weekly protests along the border fence with Israel, demanding the right of return for refugees and an end to the blockade.

events.title: Sheikh Jarrah Protests
events.description: Palestinian families in East Jerusalem's Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood face eviction, sparking widespread protests and an 11-day conflict between Israel and Hamas.

events.title: Shireen Abu Akleh Killed
events.description: Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh is killed by Israeli forces while covering a raid in Jenin, drawing international condemnation.

events.title: Israeli Judicial Reform Protests
events.description: Massive protests erupt in Israel against Netanyahu's judicial reforms, revealing internal Israeli divisions that Palestinians see as an opportunity for unity, though overshadowed by escalating tensions.

events.title: October 7 Attacks and War
events.description: Hamas launches attacks on Israel, killing over 1,200 Israelis, triggering a major Israeli military operation in Gaza that results in tens of thousands of Palestinian casualties.

events.title: ICJ Ruling on Genocide
events.description: The International Court of Justice issues a preliminary ruling ordering Israel to prevent acts of genocide in Gaza, while Palestinians continue to face severe humanitarian crisis.
